description: Hardcoded API keys, passwords, tokens, or credentials in source code
User input directly interpolated into SQL queries without parameterization
example: db.query('SELECT * FROM users WHERE id=' + userId)

description: Unescaped user input rendered as HTML or JavaScript
Resource accessed by user-controlled ID without authorization check
Endpoint or resource accessible without authentication check
User-supplied path not sanitized allowing directory traversal
Deprecated or weak cryptographic algorithms (MD5, SHA1, DES)
Sensitive endpoint (login, password-reset) lacks rate limiting
Stack traces or internal error details exposed to client
Redirect destination taken from user input without validation
N+1 query: database query inside a loop
example: users.forEach(u => db.query('SELECT * FROM roles WHERE userId=' + u.id))

description: Query on unindexed column causing full table scan
Database query without LIMIT on potentially large table
Synchronous I/O operation blocking the event loop
Event listener or resource not cleaned up, causing memory leak
Frequently read, rarely changing data fetched on every request
API response includes unnecessary fields increasing payload size
example: Returning full user object when only id/name needed

description: Nested loops or repeated computation that could be pre-computed
example: O(nÂ²) loop where O(n) possible with Map

description: Business logic in presentation layer (controller/route handler)
example: Complex calculations directly in Express route handler

description: Direct dependency between unrelated modules bypassing abstraction
Class or module doing too many unrelated things (>5 responsibilities)
example: UserService handling auth, email, payments, notifications

description: Same problem solved differently in different parts of codebase
example: Some routes use async/await, others use callbacks

description: Repeated code that should be extracted into a shared utility/service
example: Same pagination logic in 5 different controllers

description: Module A imports Module B which imports Module A
example: services/user imports services/auth which imports services/user

description: Method accesses data from another class more than its own
example: Method on OrderService mostly reads User properties

description: Unexplained numeric or string literal that should be a named constant
Variable, function, or class name doesn't reflect actual behavior
example: function saveUser() that actually deletes and re-creates

description: Commented-out code or unreachable code block left in codebase
Async operation or external call without error handling
Code style differs from surrounding codebase conventions
example: Mixed camelCase and snake_case variable names

description: Function with cyclomatic complexity > 10 or nested depth > 4
User input not validated at API boundary
example: req.body.email used directly without format check

description: New feature or bug fix has no corresponding test
example: New payment processing code with zero test coverage

description: Long function (>50 lines) should be decomposed into smaller functions
Manual implementation of functionality available in standard library
example: Custom array deduplication when Set exists

description: Could use Promise.all for parallel execution instead of sequential awaits
example: Sequential awaits for independent API calls

description: Missing type annotations or using 'any' type in TypeScript
Nested conditionals could be simplified with early return pattern
example: Multiple levels of if/else at function start
